name: Remove Toolbar
author: Ben Lobaugh

sections.description:
• NOTE: Much of this functionality is built-into the user profile now. Be sure to look there before installing this plugin as it may no longer be necessary with your version of WordPress

As of version 3.3.1 of WordPress the toolbar is required everywhere when a user is logged in.
This behavior is not always desired, especial during design phases of development.
There may also be client requirements against having the toolbar show on the front.
With this plugin you will be able to turn on/off the toolbar per user via the profile page *.

  • This functionality still in development. Currently it will remove the frontend toolbar only.
sections.installation:
1. Upload removetoolbar to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Visit your user profile page
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

  1. Upload removetoolbar to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Visit your user profile page

I want to make this plugin better

Drop one of the current contributors a line. We would love to have you.

short_description: Remove the new toolbar on a per user basis for both the front-end and back-end
